body.text:
iPhone users note there is a problem buying tickets with the Eventbrite iPhone app. Please use a web browser such as Chrome or Safari instead.

The EHCP process can feel like being lost in a jungle without a map. Parents get lost in a bewildering array of assessments, reports and meetings, and it's often hard to see the way forward. Join us for this illustrated webinar, which is a realistic discussion about the process, where Abigail and Eliza discuss the common issues parents encounter.

Dr Abigail Fisher is a qualified teacher and educational psychologist who has worked in local authorities, whilst Eliza Fricker (www.missingthemark.blog, author and illustrator of The Family Experience of PDA) is the parent of a child with an EHCP. Together they will guide you through the process, helping you understand what the EHCP is for, what it is meant to achieve and how you can get the best outcome for your child. Illustrated throughout with Eliza's cartoons, showing you the process from the inside.

It is recorded, please choose that option when you book.


Feedback from earlier webinars

Such a help to have the process explained in an understandable and digestible way!

Your knowledge is so refreshing. Thank you for raising the profile of the education system and its impact.

It was all really useful to me. I found the content and delivery easy to follow and it was helpful to hear the key issues discussed.

faqs.answer: There is a problem with the Eventbrite iPhone app. If you use a web browser such as Chrome or Safari you should be able to buy tickets.
faqs.question: Why can't I buy tickets for this event?

faqs.answer: This webinar is hosted on Zoom. Please make sure you have Zoom installed before the event, and test the audio to make sure it's working. Eventbrite will send out a reminder 2 hours before the event and 10 minutes before the event you will be emailed the webinar link.
faqs.question: How do I join the live webinar?

faqs.answer: Yes, if you choose the webinar + recording option you can watch it in your own time
faqs.question: Can I miss the webinar and watch it later?

faqs.answer: We'll send a link by the morning after the webinar
faqs.question: When will I be sent a link to the recording?

faqs.answer: You can watch the recording for 30 days after the webinar
faqs.question: How long can I watch the recording for?

faqs.answer: Please visit the general Eventbrite FAQ about this: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/help/en-gb/contact-us/
faqs.question: Questions about logging in, where are my tickets, refunds, or duplicate card charges
